content: The best time of year to hike to the base camp at Lower Saddle is typically from early July through September. During this time, the weather is usually stable, with warm and sunny days and cool nights. Snow accumulation at the higher elevations has generally melted, and the scrambling section known as the "Boulder Field" is free of snow, making the route more accessible. However, sudden changes in mountain weather can occur, and it's essential to check the weather forecast and trail conditions before beginning your hike. The Grand Teton is located in the high mountain range, and climbing or hiking during any season requires proper gear, equipment, and knowledge of the environment.
